rComments: Very considerate of the stresses of first year students, she will excuse you for missing a reading and will push back a due date if enough ppl ask. Tough grader. make sure your facts are correct and logic is sound in any presentation or essay. She wont hesitate to interrupt you in the middle of your speech to correct you. Gives good feedback.

Lectures were amazing and inspiring. She frequently offered insights into things we would not typically look for with regards to renaissance history. However, she told the class that everyone should be able to get an A-, the test was easy but the grading criteria was not clear. Lectures are disorganized. She is a feminist but at best, first wave.
Prof. Scarci is absolutely brilliant, engaging, and hands-down the best professor I have ever had at this university.

She is very passionate about the material and wants to enable her students to feel the same way. She is a bit disorganized in following the syllabus outline (which made her rush through some readings more than others) but overall it was a pretty good course. She's quite kind and easily approachable.

so nice. the readings helped but werent always necissary. a bit unorganized but not in a way that hindered her lectures or your understanding of the material. always willing to help and give extentions. very passionate and knowledgable if a bit silly (in a good way!). great prof, learned a lot
teacherRatingTags: ['Clear grading criteria', 'Accessible outside class', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: Expect unexpected!
Very disorganized teaching methods. Hard to follow. Can be rude or seem agitated when asked a question. Avoid taking a language class with her.

Very disorganized professor. If it can be avoided do not take a class with her. Even though she is nice and helpful at office hours, to be teaching at UofT you should meet a certain level of teaching quality. She lacks in the ability to engage the class, hold a productive conversation and is very disorganized in her teaching methods.

I loved Prof Scarci!She fostered an engaging classroom;very personable & gave extensions if needed. Always made a pt to greet each student(even late ones who tried to slink past).TA was a stingy marker,esp on exams. Still,Prof Scarci introduced me to many lesser-known poets.She had very profound analyses on works--she loved the subject & it showed.

Had a very high rating on the ASSU anti calender thought she would be a good prof. You can barely hear her in class. While she had a somewhat legitimate excuse she did not show up to the exam.. Made excuses for various things.

Great professor. Knows the language exceptionally and is very helpful. She always tells interesting stories that keep you engaged in her lecture. Last year in ITA252 she even made tiramisu for the class (and it was delicious!).

She loved me, so class was great and she gave me great marks on presentations and exams!  Overall, she is a great professor and made me enjoy the class because she was so passionate about the material being taught! Great professor!!!!!
Not a nice person - plays favourites, very rude if you ask a question. Made learning a language that much harder.
horrible prof, plays favourites and disorganized.
scarci is awesome because she liked me.. so yay me :)
Great Prof!!!
Best Prof. ever!
She answered all of my questions. She even made time for an extra exam study session.
Unapproachable; rude; stand-offish.
No Comments
Good prof, hard marker, very picky.
Prof. Scarci is great.  She's full of insight, knowledge, and compassion.  I'd take any course with her.

Absolutely the worst professor I've had in my entire university career!!  She is disorganized, marks arbitrarily, and is often plain rude. She is extremely arrogant (who knows why).  Scarci is the reason tenure should be abolished.

Can't stand the woman!  She can't teach, her lectures are soooo boring and she plays favorites.  She marks very unfairly.  She told me that she failed me on an essay because I didn't use "her" thesis.  Oh puhleeez!  UofT would be better without her.
Picky, yes, but a great prof.
Very unfair prof.  Can't stand her.  I can't believe she's still teaching at UofT.  UofT would be better off without her.
Very Picky
Not very patient, helpful, or clear at all.  A lot of work expected from the students; there were altogether too many tests, compositions, presentations, and quizzes.

Made translation class very easy
Prof. Scarci loves what she teaches and knows the subject extremely well.
She is the best language teacher I ever had
